answers.answer: I would consider finding an OB on your own if you can, and see them ASAP. My doctor told me to call/see L&D if something like that happened to me (and it did, but all tests came back okay and symptoms went away) but they respected me and took my concerns seriously. I felt like I was being paranoid but they told me to come in anyway to just make sure. I'm glad I did
We need a referral from our doctor here, unfortunately.But I might just try and call around anyways. Even if it's nothing, that peace of mind sure would help!
Call L&D and tell them about your symptoms. If they are interested tell them that your own doc neglected you and that you can't get a referral.

question: Im 31+6. Yesterday and the day before I started experiencing headaches, chest pain/discomfort, rapid heart rate (120bpm), nausea, and saw gold stars. Also, my stomach has been tender. So, I went to my doctor who couldn't see me until 1pm which turned into 2pm.I had a gallbladder attack a week ago and was in the hospital. I was told it needs to have a close eye on it because it could turn into an infection or gangrene.She said my heart rate is always high when I see her and dismissed my high heart rate even though at home its usually 84bpm and 75 bpm when laying down.She then chalked everything else up to me being a bit anemic according to my hospital records. Would I not have felt this awful before?She didn't even do a urine analysis to rule out infection or preeclampsia! Which really makes me upset. I thought that was routine with any sort of symptoms like this.Should I seek a second opinion or just trust my doctor? I'm having a hard time  trusting her as she was suppose to set me up with an OBGYN over 3 weeks ago now and it still hasn't happened. And then she gave me a free iron supplement sample that was expired!
title: Frustrated By Doctor
